txt.en: 'Books! I told you most clearly not to do such a thing!'

The interior of Delossad, known as Sithad in forgotten days, is dark and gloomy. Its walls have seen great sorrow, and a heavy air hangs over all.\n\nYou are searching within the dim half-light of Delossad for clues to the mystery of Amarthiel's ring, Narchuil.
'I am sorry, Sara. You did not mean any harm.'

The interior of Delossad, known as Sithad in forgotten days, is dark and gloomy. Its walls have seen great sorrow, and a heavy air hangs over all.\n\nYou are searching within the dim half-light of Delossad for clues to the mystery of Amarthiel's ring, Narchuil.
'My daughter's heart was claimed by shadow.'
'If you were given the chance to bring back one you loved from darkness...'
'...would you not take it?'
'I fear what my people might do, if they knew Narmeleth still lived.'
'I will tell Master Elrond... when Narmeleth has recovered.'
'No more books, Sara.'
'Very good, Sara. The duty is yours.'

'Hearken, [placeholder] -- many of the Angmarim that came to Tâl Bruinen are searching elsewhere, but some of them have returned to search the ruins.\n\n'Defeat those that you find here and return to me before you search inside. I do not want them to see you opening the door.'
'May you hold it for as long as your predecessor, for Narmeleth's sake.'

'[placeholder], are you all right? The Black Númenórean appeared outside Delossad, and I only had a moment in which to hide myself. Were it any other opponent, I would have engaged him in battle, but I could not hope to defeat him without others of my kindred. He came to the door and passed inside, and I followed behind him in secret, hoping beyond hope that I might oppose him in the final need.

'I shudder to think what he might have done had he known I was there!

'Let us leave this place, friend. You can tell me what you have learned as we travel out of the shadows of this sad ruin!'

'Very good, [placeholder]. Your exploration of the ruins should now be uninterrupted. A word, though, before you try the door again, my friend: Delossad is an ancient place, and some memory of great evil hangs over its stones. I fear that something terrible came from there and would ask you to keep a clear head while you are inside.

'Examine anything that seems unusual, for I believe that the memory of whatever sorrow hangs about that place will make itself known to you. Learn what you can, but remain wary -- creatures of the dark are drawn to such places, and you may need to defend yourself from them.

'I will stay on guard out here, watching to ensure that no enemies enter Delossad while you are within.'
'Let us leave this place. Memory hangs on its stones like a shroud and fills me with unease.'
'I am to bring her meals twice a day, and water with which to bathe.'
'I am to treat her kindly, but must not give her news of the world outside.'
'Do not be afraid, Narmeleth.'
'I am not to ask of her past, and she is not to leave her room.'
'I will not let them hurt you anymore.'
'I did not come here to speak with you, Amarthiel.'
'I came to speak with Narmeleth, my daughter.'
'You are Narmeleth, an Elf-smith of too great skill, and my daughter.'
'Narmeleth!'
'You will never see your ring again, Amarthiel. I have sent it beyond your reach.'
'This room, too, has an unsavoury air. I will prepare another for you.
'Narchuil is beyond your power now, Amarthiel. You will never hold it again.'
'Laerdan! I did not think....'
'I will return to see you in three days, Narmeleth.'
'She has been so lonely, Laerdan, and she asked for books... I thought....'
'What happened to her, Laerdan? Why do you keep her locked up like this?'
'Is there not someone who could help you? The Elves....'

The interior of Delossad, known as Sithad in forgotten days, is dark and gloomy. Its walls have seen great sorrow, and a heavy air hangs over all.\n\nYou are searching within the dim half-light of Delossad for clues to the mystery of Amarthiel's ring, Narchuil.

The interior of Delossad, known as Sithad in forgotten days, is dark and gloomy. Its walls have seen great sorrow, and a heavy air hangs over all.\n\nYou are searching within the dim half-light of Delossad for clues to the mystery of Amarthiel's ring, Narchuil.

You have encountered Mordrambor within the depths of Delossad, and he has locked you within one of the cells where Amarthiel was imprisoned.\n\nMuildir has come to your aid and will free you from the cell.
'Sara tells me you have not been eating, Narmeleth.'
Defeat Angmarim at Delossad ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Examine unusual items within Delossad
Examine unusual items within Delossad
Examine unusual items within Delossad
Examine unusual items within Delossad
Examine unusual items within Delossad
'[placeholder]! [placeholder]!'
Examine unusual items within Delossad
'Quickly, pass me the keys, and I will open the gate!'
Examine unusual items within Delossad
Examine unusual items within Delossad
'I will eat naught the Oakheart brings me!'
'I am Amarthiel, the Champion of Angmar! Thou cannot keep me here!'
Defeated Angmarim at Delossad ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
'I do not want any flowers.'
'I said I do not want them!'
'I do not remember Lindon! I remember only dark, terrible places!'
'I remember shouting, and the clash of swords!'
'Was I in a battle? I remember pain... and death!'
'There was a warrior... I cannot see his face....'
'I would trade it all to remember flowers.'
'I want you to listen to this very carefully, Sara.'
'She may not always be... herself.'
'She may yell at you, or threaten to strike you. Rise not to anger!'
'Narmeleth can be cured of this. I am certain of it!'
'Do you understand? Repeat to me your duties.'
Instance: Prisoner of the Free Peoples
'Is there someone there?'
'Stay away! Father! Sara!'
'I... I remember you....'
'Though the daughter of Laerdan sought to restrain me, I have the greater power!'
'My loyalty is to Angmar, ever and always! Amarthiel serves one master!'
'It will please me to exact my revenge upon the Elf Laerdan and the crone Oakheart.'
'I brought you some flowers, Narmeleth.'
'Oakheart spoke often of her cottage, taunting me with her freedom.'
'But these are so nice! Do you remember, in Lindon....'
'When my strength returns, I will see it burnt to the ground, and the crone with it...'
'Do not let her awaken, my daughter!'
'...and devise a suitable vengeance for Sara Oakheart, my thrice-cursed jailor.'
'I will prepare another room for you, my daughter. This one... has become unpleasant.'
Elf-maiden
You have travelled with Muildir to the ruins of Delossad to search for answers to the mystery of Narchuil's past.
'Ask me what thou will, worthless Elf. I may yet answer thee.'
'I am the Champion of Angmar! So shall I always be!'
'Father, I am here... I can hear you....'
'Hail, Amarthiel, Champion of Angmar!'
'Where is my ring, foolish one? Where is Narchuil?'
'Angmar has missed thee, Amarthiel. Our master grieved when thou were lost.'
'Lies! Thou hast kept it for thyself, and one day I shall take it from thee!'
'It has been many years since thou were taken, hidden from our master's sight...'
'Narmeleth is no more! Amarthiel will live forever!'
'But thou remain his humble servant, dost thou not?'
'Good. I knew it would be so.'
'In time, we will repay thy jailors sevenfold, Amarthiel.'
'We must move now with haste.'
'It is better than she deserves, Amarthiel.'
'Father... I am frightened....'
'How did I come to be here? I... do not remember!'
'Find and defeat all the Angmarim outside the entrance, [placeholder]!'
Talk to Muildir
Talk to Muildir
'Most of the Angmarim have gone to search other parts of Tâl Bruinen, but a few have returned here. Defeat them with caution, and then return to me. I do not want them to see you open the door.'
'Go now into the depths of Delossad and uncover what secrets you can, [placeholder]! I will keep watch out here to ensure that your search remains uninterrupted.'
Muildir is hiding by the entrance of Delossad.\n\nMuildir is waiting to speak with you before you investigate the ruins of Delossad.
'I welcome thee to Sithad, [placeholder], the site of thy doom.'
Some Angmarim have returned to the outskirts of Delossad to search the ruins.\n\nMuildir has told you of the Angmarim that lurk outside Delossad and wants you to defeat them before you search inside.
'These walls have seen much, have they not?'
Muildir is hiding by the entrance of Delossad.\n\nYou have defeated the Angmarim that returned to Delossad and should now return to Muildir.
'I have a message for thee, doomed [placeholder], and may it give thee joy.'

The interior of Delossad, known as Sithad in forgotten days, is dark and gloomy. Its walls have seen great sorrow, and a heavy air hangs over all.\n\nYou are searching within the dim half-light of Delossad for clues to the mystery of Amarthiel's ring, Narchuil.
'We have found Narchuil.'

The interior of Delossad, known as Sithad in forgotten days, is dark and gloomy. Its walls have seen great sorrow, and a heavy air hangs over all.\n\nYou are searching within the dim half-light of Delossad for clues to the mystery of Amarthiel's ring, Narchuil.
'Good-bye, [placeholder]. We will not meet again.'

The interior of Delossad, known as Sithad in forgotten days, is dark and gloomy. Its walls have seen great sorrow, and a heavy air hangs over all.\n\nYou are searching within the dim half-light of Delossad for clues to the mystery of Amarthiel's ring, Narchuil.
'What do you have there, Sara?'
